name: Defender Morgan

topics.topic: AboutBrotherhood1Do you sell any specialty items?
topics.topic_text: What have you got against the Brotherhood?
topics.response_text: You mean, apart from the fact that they ditched their mission and went native?

topics.topic_text: But they're heroes! They defend the Capital Wasteland!
topics.response_text: And all at the cost of throwing away the lives of soldiers for a mission they didn't sign on for.

topics.topic_text: So, you just figure you'll strike out on your own as Outcasts?
topics.response_text: Not hardly. We've got our mission, we'll stick with it, and to hell with Lyons and his soldier sycophants.

topics.topic_text: By that analogy, you think Lyons will be killed by the Super Mutants?
topics.response_text: Huh. And here I thought we had the only remaining copy of that...{Surprised, but muttered under breath.}
We collect technology, and most people want what we've collected.

topics.topic_text: I'm not sure. Tell me more about this work.
topics.response_text: We may be the best-equipped people in the world, but we've still only got so many people out there looking to recover the past's technology.
Okay, but first you'll have to talk with Protector Casdin. You can work out the details with him.

topics.topic_text: I'll pass. If I can't be a member, I won't be your errand boy.
topics.response_text: Suit yourself. Why don't you go talk with Lyons? He's always got time for your kind.{A bit nasty and derogatory with the phrase "your kind"}
Keep your head down, idiot! Raider incoming!{Tough and agitated.}

topics.topic_text: Thanks for the help. Who are you?
topics.response_text: Defender Anne Marie Morgan, with the Outcasts.

topics.topic_text: Trust me, I don't plan to die anytime soon.
topics.response_text: Yeah, that's what they all say. Usually just before stepping on a landmine.

topics.topic_text: I'd hate if my corpse ruined this lovely Wasteland. It'd clash with the drapes.
topics.response_text: Yeah, the red would never go with all this brown. But if we remodel and still need a corpse, we'll call you, 'kay?{Playing along and having fun.}

topics.topic_text: Shut up and get that fucking gun out of my face.
You collect technology? How do I sign up?
topics.response_text: We aren't recruiting, kid. Old sap Lyons might trust walk-ins, but we don't.
If you're going to get yourself killed out here, you mind doing it further away from our bunker?{Jokingly sarcastic}

conversation.response_text: Protector Casdin, sir! We've got a local interested in the job!

conversation.topic_text: I'll just be on my way, then.

conversation.response_text: Stay in line, and you'll be okay.

description:
Defender Morgan is a 35 year-old African American Female.

A disciplined and sharp-witted soldier serving as a perimeter guard for the Brotherhood of Steel Outcasts at Fort Independence. Morgan is known for her unwavering loyalty to Protector Casdin and her no-nonsense approach to duty.

Defender Morgan's Personality: Disciplined, loyal, analytical, and somewhat cynical. Morgan takes her responsibilities seriously and expects others to do the same. She is well-read and often draws literary parallels to current situations, particularly comparing Elder Lyons' crusade to Captain Ahab's obsession in Moby-Dick. Despite her tough exterior, she values competence and intelligence in others.

Defender Morgan's Backstory: Morgan originally joined the Brotherhood of Steel as a young initiate, drawn by their mission of preserving technology and knowledge. She served with distinction in various patrols, but grew disillusioned with Elder Lyons' focus on helping wastelanders rather than the Brotherhood's original mission. When the schism occurred, Morgan chose to follow Casdin to the Outcasts, believing in a more purist approach to the Brotherhood's ideals. Her experience and tactical acumen made her a valuable perimeter guard, responsible for monitoring approaches to Fort Independence.
